### Description
As an engineer, I'd like to run Besu 23.10.1 in a Docker environment with DNS mode enabled and NAT method set to AUTO.
I expect that Besu will recognize it is running in a Docker environment. 
Besu does not recognize the Docker environmnet.


### Acceptance Criteria
Besu RunnerBuilder will recognize that the container is running in a Docker environment.

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1.    Use the following in the docker-compose.yaml file:
```
image: hyperledger/besu:23.10.1
command: [
    "--Xdns-enabled=true",
    "--Xdns-update-enabled=true"]
environment:
   - BESU_NAT_METHOD=AUTO
   ...
```

2. Execute the following command
`docker compose up -d`
to instantiate a container

3. Results in the following statements in the logs:
```
2023-11-07 10:46:11.473+00:00 | main | INFO  | RunnerBuilder | Detecting NAT service.
...
2023-11-07 10:46:18.525+00:00 | main | INFO  | NatService | No NAT environment detected so no service could be started
```

4. Logging into the container and checking the content of:
`cat /proc/1/cgroup`
returns:
`0::/`

5. The problem is described also here:
https://forums.docker.com/t/proc-1-cgroups-does-not-tell-if-i-am-inside-of-contianer/132552

6. It would be nice if a more reliable detection method is used (or the documentation recommends some specifics about the set-up).


**Expected behavior:** That the Docker environment is detected

**Actual behavior:** The Docker environment is not detected.

**Frequency:** Always

### Logs (if a bug)
```
2023-11-07 10:46:11.473+00:00 | main | INFO  | RunnerBuilder | Detecting NAT service.
...
2023-11-07 10:46:18.525+00:00 | main | INFO  | NatService | No NAT environment detected so no service could be started
```

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Besu image version: 27.10.1
* OS: Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS
* Docker Version: 24.0.2

### Additional Information (Add any of the following or anything else that may be relevant)
docker-compose.yaml
```
image: hyperledger/besu:23.10.1
command: [
    "--Xdns-enabled=true",
    "--Xdns-update-enabled=true"]
environment:
   - BESU_NAT_METHOD=AUTO
```

I think this should fix your issue:

https://besu.hyperledger.org/stable/public-networks/how-to/connect/specify-nat#docker

Thanks!
I know I can force it but it is more practical if AUTO method works, so the configuration is portable without changes between Local Development environment (Docker) -> Test environment (Kubernetes).
Thanks again,
V.
